page.title: 18POOLS AND PONDS
page.content: Within the area are the Tri-lakes, a privately owned water park where fish are bred and released for angling. The third largest carp ever caught (43 lbs) was landed here as well as a 16 lb pike. In the country park are several pools. Around Wyndhams Pool grow the rare insect-eating sundew plant, and Bog Asphodel and cotton grass. This is a conservation area for birds, plants insects and fishes and mammals. There have been badger setts here for about 150 years. There is a nature trail, picnic area, boating pond for model boats and facilities for coarse fishing. The Old Hospital pond is only for naturalists and not for angling.
